whole_object: "After a day of petal-pushing at work, I like to come back to a room that really knows how to flower up the decor!" (Wordplay)
single_object:
- Bed: "I told my bed about my dreams, but it just rolled its eyes and said, 'Get a pillow!'"
- Painting: "This painting really knows how to draw a crowd, but it’s still hanging around!"
- Wall lamp: "I asked the wall lamp for advice, but it just said, 'Lighten up!'"
- Mirror: "The mirror and I have a love-hate relationship; it reflects my best side but also my worst hair days!"
- Nightstand: "My nightstand is like a magician; it makes my phone disappear every time I need it!"
- Phone: "My phone is so smart, it even knows when I’m about to drop it—talk about a call for help!"
- Light switch: "I told the light switch to brighten my day, but it just flicked me off!"
- Electrical outlet: "The electrical outlet is always plugged into the latest gossip; it really knows how to connect!"
multi_object:
- Bed  
- Nightstand  
- "I told the bed to wake me up, but it just kept snoozing like the nightstand was telling bedtime stories!"  

- Painting  
- Mirror  
- "The painting was feeling a bit reflective, but the mirror just kept saying, 'You think you're the only one with a frame of reference?'"  

- Wall lamp  
- Light switch  
- "The wall lamp and the light switch had a bright idea, but the switch just kept flickering between 'on' and 'off' like it was playing hard to get!"  

- Mirror  
- Phone  
- "The mirror was tired of selfies; it told the phone, 'I reflect on my life, not just your angles!'"  

- Nightstand  
- Electrical outlet  
- "The nightstand was feeling charged up, but the electrical outlet just said, 'Don't plug me into your drama!'"  

- Phone  
- Bed  
- "The phone tried to call the bed for a cozy chat, but the bed just texted back, 'I'm too busy dreaming!'"  

- Light switch  
- Wall lamp  
- "The light switch and the wall lamp had a bright relationship, but they always argued about who turned the mood on!"  

- Electrical outlet  
- Painting  
- "The electrical outlet admired the painting, saying, 'You may be a masterpiece, but I’m the one with all the connections!'"
